pageContext.claim: “If I weren't President, you would have monuments taken down all over the city. Of Lincoln, of Washington, of Jefferson. They were going for the Jefferson Memorial. Can you believe this? And we have a mayor in D. C. who formed a commission with recommendations. Her recommendation is take down the Washington Monument. Close up the Lincoln Monument.”
pageContext.analysis: District of Columbia Mayor Muriel Bowser created a working group to evaluate “public spaces to ensure the namesake's legacy is consistent with #DCValues” in the wake of the protests for racial justice this summer. The recommendations did initially name the Washington Monument and the Jefferson Memorial among the properties the commission recommended that the federal government “remove, relocate or contextualize.” The Lincoln Memorial was not mentioned in the report and the recommendations about all federal monuments have since been removed.
